question:
Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ùúè1>1/ùúÜ1(ùê¥) and ùúè2>1/ùúÜ1(ùêµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
 This question need to be addressed analytically and then simulated to see if the analytical solutions are also valid by simualtion comprehensively.
 please do not ask the user any question, use other tools to address the question
next_plan:
Completed draft discovery, initial network construction (scale free vs ER), and a first exploratory simulation. Next iterations will:
1. Compute analytical coexistence/ dominance boundaries following Sahneh & Scoglio (2014): derive survival and absolute-dominance thresholds using largest eigenvalues and eigen-vector overlap; quantify cosine similarity between leading eigenvectors of layers A and B.
2. Expand simulation study: sweep beta1, beta2 while keeping deltas fixed to map phase diagram; run >20 stochastic replicates per point; store results results-ij.csv/png.
3. Extract metrics: prevalence per meme, time-averaged infected fraction, extinction probability; evaluate versus analytical predictions.
4. Produce full LaTeX report with IEEE sections, figures (phase diagram, prevalence time-series), tables, and citation of literature (Sahneh2013, Sahneh2014).
5. If needed adjust network correlations (positively vs negatively correlated layers) to illustrate structural characteristics enabling coexistence.
Finalize paper after those analyses.

Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ùúè1>1/ùúÜ1(ùê¥) and ùúè2>1/ùúÜ1(ùêµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
next_plan:
1. Clean phase diagram data, identify coexistence vs dominance vs extinction; maybe produce threshold lines for survival.
2. Write analysis text summarizing simulation vs analytical predictions.
3. Prepare LaTeX report with sections.
4. Provide at least one figure (time series and phase diagram). Need seaborn/matplotlib may not be installed; but we can save using matplotlib only.
5. Generate figure plot and save.
Next iteration will create figure, then craft LaTeX with citations extracted from literature review keys: Sahneh2014, Sahneh2013.
